ticket.title: time scaffolding uses datetime_select, stores as time
ticket.original-body:
In Rails 2.3.2,
script/generate scaffold tester birthday:date favorite_time:time
rake db:migrate
script/server
Then visit http://localhost:3000/testers/.
The scaffolding will use `datetime_select` to represent the time, but won't store the date information. The odd result is that the user is asked for and shown the date, but that information isn't real - it's always 1/1/2000.
Previous versions of Rails also showed and asked for the date when they generated scaffolding for time data, but didn't throw it away. The scaffold generation needs to shift to `time_select` to match the expectations of the underlying datatype.

rake db:migrate
script/server
Then visit http://localhost:3000/testers/.
The scaffolding will use `datetime_select` to represent the time, but won't store the date information. The odd result is that the user is asked for and shown the date, but that information isn't real - it's always 1/1/2000.
Previous versions of Rails also showed and asked for the date when they generated scaffolding for time data, but didn't throw it away. The scaffold generation needs to shift to `time_select` to match the expectations of the underlying datatype.
ticket.original-body-html:
In Rails 2.3.2,

script/generate scaffold tester birthday:date favorite_time:time

rake db:migrate

script/server

Then visit http://localhost:3000/testers/.

>

The scaffolding will use datetime_select to represent the time, but won't store the date information. The odd result is that the user is asked for and shown the date, but that information isn't real - it's always 1/1/2000.

Previous versions of Rails also showed and asked for the date when they generated scaffolding for time data, but didn't throw it away. The scaffold generation needs to shift to time_select to match the expectations of the underlying datatype.

In Rails 2.3.2,
script/generate scaffold tester birthday:date favorite_time:time

script/server
Then visit http://localhost:3000/testers/.
The scaffolding will use `datetime_select` to represent the time, but won't store the date information. The odd result is that the user is asked for and shown the date, but that information isn't real - it's always 1/1/2000.
Previous versions of Rails also showed and asked for the date when they generated scaffolding for time data, but didn't throw it away. The scaffold generation needs to shift to `time_select` to match the expectations of the underlying datatype.
version.body-html:
In Rails 2.3.2,

script/generate scaffold tester birthday:date favorite_time:time

rake db:migrate

script/server

Then visit http://localhost:3000/testers/.

>

The scaffolding will use datetime_select to represent the time, but won't store the date information. The odd result is that the user is asked for and shown the date, but that information isn't real - it's always 1/1/2000.

Previous versions of Rails also showed and asked for the date when they generated scaffolding for time data, but didn't throw it away. The scaffold generation needs to shift to time_select to match the expectations of the underlying datatype.

version.body: verified this behavior still exists on both 2.3.5 and master, this issue is probably not mission critical as scaffolds can be changed easily, please submit a patch. for now can probably as mark incomplete.

version.body:
(from [3568c5cee0f37f3302d739472be7477bee1b0d2a]) using :time_select when the attribute type is :time in the scaffold generator. [#2377 state:resolved]
Signed-off-by: José Valim <jose.valim@gmail.com> http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/3568c5cee0f37f3302d739472be7477bee1b0d2a

version.body: Ops, I forgot to apply the patch with tests. I just asked Jeff on #railsbridge to refactor the current tests (using something like assert_attribute_type and remove the code duplication) and provide new patches with only tests!

version.body: Shoes are the most important equipment for basketball players. I don't want to risk any gucci loafers for men kind of injury and sprain or break my ankle, so I have louis vuitton flip flops to examine the catalogs of shoes to know which ones offer the best ankle support gucci slippers and best fit for my feet. What with the constant starting, stopping, gucci shoes for cheap jumping, and lateral movements that basketball play louis vuitton loafers for men requires, I have to prioritize support, foot stability, and shock absorption. Also, the shoes must have good traction.
version.body-html:
Shoes are the most important equipment for basketball players. I don't want to risk any gucci loafers for men kind of injury and sprain or break my ankle, so I have louis vuitton flip flops to examine the catalogs of shoes
to know which ones offer the best ankle support gucci slippers and best fit for my feet. What with the constant starting, stopping, gucci shoes for cheap jumping, and lateral movements that basketball play louis vuitton loafers for men requires, I have to prioritize support, foot stability, and shock absorption. Also, the shoes must have good traction.
